page.title: 15BRITISH AEROSPACE, KINGSTON
page.content: In Ham,{British Aerospace}is the only large factory. It has a workforce of 3,800 people. Today they make{ {Harriers}and{Hawks}in Ham. The whole planes are not made there. Three different factories make parts and they are sent to Ham to be fitted together. The wings are not joined on until the plane is taken to Dunsford near Guildford to be tested. The{Harrier}is a one seater fighter plane and has vertical take off and landing. They were used successfully in the {Falklands}War. They fly at mach 2.5 and cost about Â£12 million. The{Hawk}is a two seater trainer, flying at just under the speed of sound. It is used by the{R.A.F.}and by the{U.S.Marines.}The {Red Devils,}the areobatic display team also use them.
